definition: The valuation of a company before external funding or the latest round of funding.
The valuation of a company after external funding or the latest round of funding.
The rate at which a startup spends its venture capital to finance overhead costs before generating positive cash flow.
The cost to acquire a new customer, calculated by dividing total acquisition costs by the number of new customers.
The predicted revenue a customer will generate throughout their relationship with a company.
A non-binding agreement outlining the basic terms and conditions of an investment.
A short-term debt that converts into equity at a future funding round.
An investment instrument providing rights to future equity without determining a specific price per share at the time of investment.
The decrease in ownership percentage of existing shareholders when new shares are issued.
A spreadsheet showing the equity capitalization of a startup, listing all securities and their owners.
The amount of time a startup has before it runs out of cash, assuming current income and expense levels stay constant.
Evidence of market validation and customer demand for a product or service.
